bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 11, 1893

div1.p: Lazear visits the World's Colombian Exposition in Chicago. He comments on traveling.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 11, 1893
div1.opener:
TOWER HOTEL,
STONY ISLAND AVENUE,
NEAR
65TH ST. ENTRANCE TO WORLD'S FAIR,
H. T. BLAKE, MANAGER,
LATE PROPRIETOR IRON SPRINGS HOTEL,
MANITOU, COL. AND MEXICAN GULF HOTEL,
PASS CHRISTIAN, MISS.
CHICAGO Sep. 11, 1893.
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I reached
here early this morning
and I have been doing
the fair all day. I am
consequently pretty well
tired out. I will not
attempt to tell you what
I think of the fair until
I see you. I took a
superficial look at the
whole thing to-day, and
I have decided just what
it is worth while to
go over carefully. I am
an experienced sightseer
and I waste no time
I am sure that I
can see all that I
want to see in three
days. Therefore I shall
probably be in Hatley on
Saturday morning.

TOWER HOTEL,
STONY ISLAND AVENUE,
NEAR
65TH ST. ENTRANCE TO WORLD'S FAIR,
H. T. BLAKE, MANAGER,
LATE PROPRIETOR IRON SPRINGS HOTEL,
MANITOU, COL. AND MEXICAN GULF HOTEL,
PASS CHRISTIAN, MISS.

I came by the New York
Central and I return
by the same road.
I do not think I
shall be able to see
the Keighlers. It would
take too much time.
The people here are rather
interesting - very good,
very thin and very
stupid - in all
particulars differing from
our Irish New York
crowd. Sightseeing and
traveling are very wearisome
and I heartily wish
I had reached the
Hatley part of my
vacation
